titles.title: It Is Well With My Soul

authors.author: Horatio G. Spafford Philip Paul Bliss

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: It is well, with my soul, newline It is well, newline It is well, with my soul.

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: When peace like a river, newline Attendeth my way, newline When sorrows, newline Like sea billows roll; newline Whatever my lot, newline Thou hast taught me to say, newline "It is well, newline It is well, with my soul."

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Though Satan should buffet, newline Tho' trials should come, newline Let this blest assurance control; newline That Christ has regarded newline My helpless estate, newline And hath shed His own blood newline For my soul.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: My sin, O the bliss newline Of this glorious tho't, newline My sin not in part newline But the whole newline Is nailed to the cross newline And I bear it no more. newline Praise the Lord, newline Praise the Lord, O my soul!

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: O, Lord haste the day newline When my faith shall be sight, newline The clouds be rolled back newline As a scroll; newline The trump shall resound newline And the Lord shall descend, newline "Even so" it is well newline With my soul.
